channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic lights timingd, 9th April
item.description:
Traffic lights coming from Barnwood direction toward Longlevens are only lasting a couple seconds on green allowing max 3 cars to go. Traffic is building up all the way past the Walls building as a result. Rest of the roundabout lights seem normal, letting around 6/7 cars so just seems to be one set affected
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: 10 inch Pothole in Road, 9th April
item.description:
Pothole in Road outside 29 Albemarle Rd, GL3 2HE… I reported 2 a few days ago, and one of the potholes has been repaired but this one (reference 22045843) although reported as fixed has not been…. The other one outside 25 Albemarle Rd has been fixed Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 potholes, 9th April
item.description:
Three potholes going up the hill between temp roadworks and last big right hand turn before Birdlip. The potholes are in line with passenger side car wheel. Could not see them in the dark last night but each one resulted in a big bang as my front wheel hit it. This is a correction to Web Reference: 5826856, Enquiry Number: 22046427 with the right location.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic Lights not working correctly, 9th April
item.description:
Traffic lights at Elmbridge Court Roundabout (going past Nuffield Gym/Bowling Alley on A417) only stay green for about 10 seconds and is causing big tail backs as only a few cars are able to go through lights. This has been going on for 2 days. Please could this be rectified soonest, thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Traffic lights, 9th April
item.description:
The traffic’s lights coming out of Gloucester from a417 to get onto Elmbridge court roundabout have changed causing major delays. It’s just taken me 25 minutes to get from Nuffield to Elmbridge court at 6.50am (usually takes 2 minutes at that time), so I dread to think what rush hour will be like. The lights stay green for approx 5 seconds before changing back to red for another 40/50 seconds (when they used to stay on much longer). I’m not sure why this has changed but it definitely needs resolving asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Blocked drain, 8th April
item.description:
The blocked drain is located on the corner of North Place near Clarence Sq. After heavy rain the flooding causes cyclists to go wide In order to avoid the surface water and turn into oncoming traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain at pedestrian drop curb, 8th April
item.description:
The drain located opposite Neptunes Fountain is blocked creating hazard for pedestrians. The drain on the opposite carriageway is also blocked creating a similar issue. After heavy rain the surface water remains for several days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 118, Promenade, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes for years. Generally just a very bad part of Grafton Road. Rather than just keep "patching up" the road it would make more financial sense to completely resurface it. The double yellow lines could also do with painting again. The rest of Grafton road is lovely but the area off the Bath road reallyblets it down!!, 8th April
item.description:

item.title: Trees damaging our wall and blocking light, 8th April
item.description:
The trees are in Parabola Close and planted on the verge inside the double yellow line very close to the back wall of our property Hadley House, Bayshill Road, Cheltenham, GL50 3AW. Our wall is showing signs of cracking - see photo 3. The trees have grown very fast and starting to take light. They also sway alarmingly in the wind and could fall, further damaging out wall. I understand they may have been planted by the owner of the cottages on the west side of Parabola Close but on land owned by the County Council and not by them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Parabola Close, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
